result.execSummary:
The defendant Kirk A. Jones Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Not enter any store w/ parents Sherri or Kirk J, Sr.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirk A. Jones Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Allen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty J Allen appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Allen states the deft contacted him stating his ride fell through.  PLEAS set over to 4/1/16 at 11am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Allen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Allen states the case will be resolved.  PLEAS set for 3/31/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Allen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Allen states the case may resolve.  JSH 3/9/16 at 8:30am and JS 4/18/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Jennifer Phan

*No Contact w/Walmart.  *Not To Discuss Case w/Kirk J, Sr. or Sherie J.
943.50(1m)(b) -Misd Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), PTAC

159 p.m.  Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hillary Edwards.  Clk  Janell Thwing.  Not Guilty plea.  Deft demands jury trial. Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 02:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.. $2500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
and witness list filed by the State
